description: Originally designed during the Cold War, this gun is probably the most successful battle rifle ever designed.  Despite being labeled as obsolete, its tunable gas system ensures both reliability and low recoil, allowing the FAL to keep up even among modern competitors.  This is a semi-automatic clone built by a domestic manufacturer.

variants.description: Originally designed during the Cold War, the FAL is probably the most successful battle rifle ever designed.  Despite being labeled as obsolete, its tunable gas system ensures both reliability and low recoil, allowing the FAL to keep up even among modern competitors.  This is a semi-automatic clone of the SA-58 pattern built by DSA.

//: The front and rear sights aren't on the same receiver.

description: A semi-automatic, domestically produced clone of an early battle rifle developed after the end of WWII.  Known as the PTR 91, it is a fantastically reliable, cheap to produce rifle that continues to serve in conflict regions.  Though the action is legendary, its handling characteristics and harsher recoil leave something to be desired.

variants.description: A semi-automatic, domestically produced clone of an early battle rifle developed after the end of WWII.  The PTR 91 is a fantastically reliable, cheap to produce rifle that continues to serve in conflict regions.  Though the action is legendary, its handling characteristics and harsher recoil leave something to be desired.

A semi-automatic, domestically produced clone of the CETME Model C, the progenitor of the famous H&K G3 battle rifle.  The CETME is a fantastically reliable, cheap to produce rifle that continues to serve in conflict regions.  Though the action is legendary, its handling characteristics and harsher recoil leave something to be desired.

description: The M134D-H Minigun is a (relatively) lightweight heavy rotary machine gun.  Its six barrels are rotated by an electric motor, powered by UPS or vehicle.  If you could find enough ammo for it, it would become a devastating weapon.  It must be mounted on a vehicle before use.
A highly modified version of the M14 rifle designed to cover both CQB and designated marksman roles.  A very powerful and versatile rifle, if somewhat heavy.
//: These *sometimes* have the mode selector disabled, but disabling it isn't difficult for operators.

description: This civilian variant of an American battle rifle is essentially a rifle from World War 2 with a detachable magazine stuck in it that was sold to the military as a cheap, do-all rifle that could replace many other weapon systems.  While it delivered none of those things, it was an acceptable rifle, if marginally inferior to its contemporaries.

variants.description: This civilian variant of the M14 is essentially the M1 Garand from World War 2 with a detachable magazine stuck in it that was sold to the military as a cheap, do-all rifle that could replace many other weapon systems.  While it delivered none of those things, it was an acceptable rifle, if marginally inferior to its contemporaries.

description: The M240 is a medium machine gun used by the US military, replacing the older M60.  Quite inaccurate and difficult to control, the M240 is designed to fire many rounds very quickly.
The M60 is a general-purpose machine gun developed to replace the .30-caliber M1918 and M1919.  Heavy and difficult to handle fired from the shoulder, as most people aren't action-movie heroes.
A semi-automatic civilian variant of the M60 machine gun, retaining the ability to be belt fed, an uncommon feature in civilian firearms.
A very accurate rifle chambered for the powerful .308 round.  Its very low ammo capacity is offset by its accuracy and near-complete lack of recoil.
A highly accurate and modular battle rifle specially designed for the United States Special Operations Command.  The 'H' in its name stands for heavy, as it uses the powerful .308 round.

Sniper Support Rifle, this semi-auto variant of SCAR-H is designed for a long-range precision application, to be used by dedicated marksman.  Includes extended barrel, bipod, and a few additional attachment for greater comfort of a user.

variants.description: Sniper Support Rifle, this semi-auto variant of SCAR-H is designed for a long-range precision application, to be used by dedicated marksman.  Includes extended barrel, bipod, and a few additional attachment for greater comfort of a user.

description: A highly accurate and modular battle rifle specially designed for the United States Special Operations Command.  This one is a civilian model, limited to semi-auto.

variants.description: The SCAR 17S is the semi-auto version of the SCAR-H rifle used in the military.  With how powerful .308 is, maybe having it in semi-auto only is a blessing.

description: The M24 Sniper is the military and police version of the Remington Model 700 rifle, M24 being the model name assigned by the United States Army after adoption as their standard sniper rifle in 1988.  The M24 is referred to as a 'weapon system' because it consists of not only a rifle, but also a detachable telescopic sight and other accessories.
A German battle rifle with a 13" barrel and telescopic stock.  It is a gas-operated, rotating bolt rifle with a short-stroke piston design similar to that of the G36.

variants.description: A German battle rifle with a 13" barrel and telescopic stock.  It is a gas-operated, rotating bolt rifle with a short-stroke piston design similar to that of the G36.

description: A gas-operated, rotating bolt rifle accurate to 1.5 MOA with standard ammunition, and featuring an aluminum upper receiver for reduced weight.

variants.description: A derivative of H&K's G28 with an aluminum upper receiver to meet US Army weight requirements.  It is a gas-operated, rotating bolt rifle accurate to 1.5 MOA with standard ammunition.

description: A civilian AK pattern rifle, chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO.

variants.description: A Serbian-made AK pattern rifle made by Zastava in 7.62x51mm NATO.  To avoid import restrictions, Zastava USA has added a number of American-made parts.

description: Somewhat similar to the later AR-15, the AR-10 is a gas-operated, rotating bolt rifle chambered for 7.62x51mm rounds.
This is a semi-automatic bullpup rifle with a lightened body due to the use of polymers and aluminum, using standard magazines of the heavy automatic rifle and a 7.62x51mm cartridge.

variants.description: This is a semi-automatic bullpup rifle with a lightweight, polymer frame, using magazines from the FN FAL and the .308 Winchester cartridge.  The rifle, forward-ejection, bullpup (abbreviated as RFB) features forward case ejection, ambidextrous controls, and structural use of the barrel, uncommon in modern designs.

description: This is a versatile, all-purpose hunting rifle.  To this end, it is exceedingly lightweight, contains an inbuilt polymer bipod, and fits a spare magazine inside the stock for fast reloading.  While these features made for a hunting rifle too universal for widespread adoption, they might yet fulfill a vital scouting niche for survivors in the post-Cataclysm world.

variants.description: The Steyr Scout is Steyr's interpretation of Jeff Cooper's concept of a 'scout rifle', a versatile, all-purpose hunting rifle.  To this end, it is exceedingly lightweight, and contains a built-in polymer bipod, and fits a spare magazine inside the stock for fast reloading.  While these features made for a hunting rifle too universal for widespread adoption, they might yet fulfill a vital scouting niche for survivors in the post-Cataclysm world.

//: Has a MOA of ~1.33, while the M24 with 85 dispersion has a MOA of ~1.0. Basically like 50% more dispersion.
